io.github.ddimitrov.nuggets

Class Threads

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.ddimitrov.nuggets.Threads

  • public class Threads
extends Object

    Entry Point Introspects the running threads and provides access to their runnable delegates, can take a snapshot list of all running threads. Useful for whitebox testing as well as ensuring orderly shutdown.

    An instance of this class corresponds to a ThreadGroup instance, providing access to its contained threads.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Threads(@NotNull ThreadGroup threadGroup)
      Creates a new instance, introspecting the threads in threadGroup

      • getAllThreads

        @Contract(pure=true)
 @NotNull
public static @NotNull Threads getAllThreads()
        Creates an instance introspecting all threads in the JVM.
        Returns:
        an instance introspecting the top-level thread group
        See Also:
        Threads(ThreadGroup), getSiblingThreads(), getParentGroupThreads()

      • getSiblingThreads

        @Contract(pure=true)
 @NotNull
public static @NotNull Threads getSiblingThreads()
        Creates an instance introspecting all threads in the same thread group with the current thread.
        Returns:
        an instance introspecting the current thread group
        See Also:
        Threads(ThreadGroup), getAllThreads(), getParentGroupThreads()

      • getParentGroupThreads

        @Contract(pure=true)
 @Nullable
public @Nullable Threads getParentGroupThreads()
        Creates an instance introspecting all threads in the parent thread group of the thread group wrapped by this instance.
        Returns:
        an instance introspecting the parent thread group or null if this is the top group
        See Also:
        Threads(ThreadGroup), getAllThreads(), getSiblingThreads()

      • containedGroups

        @NotNull
public @NotNull List<ThreadGroup> containedGroups(boolean recurse)

        Returns a best effort list of all thread groups contained by the wrapped thread group.

        Note that as thread groups are created and die asynchronously, there is a natural race condition. We guarantee that this method will not fail and each element of the data has been valid at some point in time, but possibly not at the same point in time.

        Parameters:
        recurse - true to return thread groups contained in child thread groups, false to return only direct children
        Returns:
        list of thread groups.
        See Also:
        Threads(ThreadGroup), getParentGroupThreads()

      • containedThreads

        @NotNull
public @NotNull List<Thread> containedThreads(boolean recurse)

        Returns a best effort list of all threads contained by the wrapped thread group.

        Note that as threads are created and die asynchronously, there is a natural race condition. We guarantee that this method will not fail and each element of the data has been valid at some point in time, but possibly not at the same point in time.

        Parameters:
        recurse - true to return threads contained in child thread groups, false to return only threads having this thread-group as a parent.
        Returns:
        list of thread groups.
        See Also:
        getAll()

      • getAll

        @NotNull
public @NotNull List<Runnable> getAll()

        Returns a best effort list of all runnables contained by the wrapped thread group.

        Note that as threads are created and die asynchronously, there is a natural race condition. We guarantee that this method will not fail and each element of the data has been valid at some point in time, but possibly not at the same point in time.

        Returns:
        list of thread runnables.
        See Also:
        containedThreads(boolean), getByName(), getWithUniqueName()

      • getByName

        @NotNull
public @NotNull Map<String,List<Runnable>> getByName()

        Returns a best effort multi-map of thread-names to runnables for all threads contained by the wrapped thread group. If there are more than one threads with the same name, their runnables are put in a list.

        Example:

        
     threads.getByName().get("SEDA-PROCESSOR").forEach(SedaProcessor::stop);
     assert threads.getByName().get("ComponentX").get(0).getFoo() == 42;

        Note that as threads are created and die asynchronously, there is a natural race condition. We guarantee that this method will not fail and each element of the data has been valid at some point in time, but possibly not at the same point in time.

        Returns:
        list of thread runnables.
        See Also:
        containedThreads(boolean), getAll(), getWithUniqueName()

      • getWithUniqueName

        @NotNull
public @NotNull Map<String,Runnable> getWithUniqueName()

        Returns a best effort map of thread-names to runnables for all uniquely named threads contained by the wrapped thread group. If there are more than one threads with the same name, their runnables are ignored.

        Example:

        
     assert threads.getByName().get("ComponentX").getFoo() == 42;

        Note that as threads are created and die asynchronously, there is a natural race condition. We guarantee that this method will not fail and each element of the data has been valid at some point in time, but possibly not at the same point in time.

        Returns:
        list of thread runnables.
        See Also:
        containedThreads(boolean), getAll(), getByName()

      • extractRunnable

        @Contract(pure=true)
 @NotNull
public static @NotNull Runnable extractRunnable(@NotNull
                                                                               @NotNull Thread thread)
        Extracts the runnable that the thread was created with, or returns the thread itself if it was created with null runnable.
        Parameters:
        thread - the thread we are interested in
        Returns:
        the runnable whose run() method implements the logic for this thread.
